data.title: Add option to display trailing whitespace
data.body:
vscode currently has functionality to automatically delete trailing whitespace when a file is saved. That is pretty good, but I think this is insufficient: I have encountered a few times where trailing whitespace was _required_ because of various reasons, and thus enabling automatic removal makes me a bit uncomfortable because it would mess up with those cases.

I think it'd be beneficial if there was an option to display trailing whitespace instead.

The way this would work is by displaying the trailing whitespace in red. It is important to only display the trailing whitespace when the cursor is _not_ positioned after the trailing whitespace: you do not want to see the scary red box when you hit Enter to start a new line and the new line is autoindented. The trailing whitespace is then clearly visible at any time and can be dealt with immediately.

Other, more mature editors do this.

data.title: ESLint works when ESLint extension is installed. Docs describes ESLint support without mentioning the extension
data.body:
The docs at https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/javascript describes configuration of ESLint. However, it didn't work out of the box as I expected.

I had to install the ESLint extension then it worked as documented. 

The documentation doesn't mention the extension. Should it or am I missing something?

data.title: Where is Electron?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When I run "code ." from the command line, I keep getting a dialog popping up saying "Where is Electron?" and asking me to locate it on disk.
- Why is it asking me this?
- What can I do about it?

![screen shot 2015-11-19 at 1 14 20 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/82750/11284593/815e82ae-8ebf-11e5-8627-9e3e62bffaf5.png)

I'm running Version 0.10.1 on Mac OS.

data.title: Git remote options (push, pull & sync) are disabled

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Although my local git repository has a remote repo setup and it is behind the remote the options to push, pull or sync are disabled.

```
git remote -v
origin  https://github.com/daniel-a-melo/angular-typescript.git (fetch)
origin  https://github.com/daniel-a-melo/angular-typescript.git (push)

git status
# On branch master
# Your branch is ahead of 'origin/master' by 1 commit.
#
nothing to commit (working directory clean)
```

data.title: Microsoft Edge not included in IntelliSense browser support info
data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/497788c0bcd20859f736d585b49c208af8dd518f/src/vs/languages/css/common/services/languageFacts.ts#L476

The auto-complete lacks MS Edge info. Presumably it needs to be added at the line above. I can make the PR request myself if needed, but I'm not sure if it needs plumbed in in other locations too?

data.title: Reverse the Notification Stacking Order
data.body:
Typically with notifications that slide down vertically (ie. growl), the newest item should be on top and the older items get pushed down. 

What currently happens is the new notification is _appended_ to the bottom of the list and the entire list slides down again. This is very visually confusing and doesn't fit the common UI pattern for this sort of notification. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8117360/11283830/d09f3d14-8ec3-11e5-9de8-d958e5692476.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8117360/11283730/55976150-8ec3-11e5-8ce5-6582e7815bf8.png)

data.title: Regex unable to find/replace blank lines
data.body:
Using regex expressions am unable to find empty lines. Tried both the end of line sequence. 
Copying the same text in sublime simple \n finds all the blank lines.

data.title: [jade] colorizing broken
data.body:
Hello,

After the last update, Jade's highlighting is full of blue.

Thanks.

data.title: Add more extensions to built-in PowerShell support
data.body:
This change adds the .pssc and .psrc file extensions to the built-in
PowerShell support.

data.title: Debugging asp.net 5 applications
data.body:
On https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/debugging the following question is asked:

Q: What are the supported debugging scenarios?

A: Debugging of Node.js based applications is supported on Linux, OS X, and Windows. Debugging of C# applications running on Mono is supported on Linux and OS X. ASP.NET 5 applications are compiled using the Roslyn compiler, not the Mono compiler. **ASP.NET 5 debugging will be available through a VS Code extension**.

And as extension now are available in vscode, will we be able to debug ASP.NET 5 applications soon?

data.title: One click script for installing on linux
data.body: This makes an entry of visual studio code in the main menu bar of Linux based Operating systems and gives a one click script to install VSCode to the `/usr/local/vscode` folder, using this script the menu bar can identify that VSCode is a development tool and the users won't have to do the manual stuff which is too boring and frankly ruins the reputation of such an amazing tool, Microsoft just revolutionized the way many write code on Linux, this is a statement which none of us imagined to be hearing ever.

data.title: Markdown syntax broken since last update
data.body:
Since last update markdown syntax doesn't work the way it worked before.

only links and tabbed lines are colored red. the rest is plain white, it's like reading from notepad.

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8350237/11281990/64ce064e-8efd-11e5-8270-fa49fe28d0aa.png)

data.title: Supporting creating a new document virtually
data.body: Extensions should be able to create a new panel/document and open it in the editor, much like how markdown preview does.

data.title: xml formatting no longer an option
data.body:
After updating to 0.10.1, I can no longer format code on XML documents

Repro steps:
1. Open .xml file
2. Right click, there is no Format Code option
2 (alternate). Shift+Alt+F, does not format the code

data.title: Linux: cups and other dependencies
data.body:
In [Requirements](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/supporting/requirements) VS Code noted as requiring only versions of libc and libcxx defined.
Actual experience showed me that it needs, at least, CUPS installed and refuses to start in the environment lacking libcups.so.2
As I am Gentoo user without the need to print stuff from my computer, CUPS wasn't installed and so VS Code refused to start.

Please, note that CUPS is needed in requirements page or remove dependency.

Also, curious look at the executable shows me that VS Code depends on number of other libraries, some understandable, some not. For example, Netscape Portable Runtime.

data.title: Shell script to install vs code in Unix systems

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
We need a shell script which will be a one click install for vs code in a unix machine, the thing is when we run the app in linux it opens as an internal app and it isn't registered with the machine, we need a `.desktop` file to register an app there, I am willing to submit the patch which I am writing to install vscode in my elementary os desktop, it'd be great if you guys accept it!

We can distribute it in the code and in the final release.

data.title: Extension update notifications

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Is there any autoupdate mechanism for extensions, or do they need to be updated manually?

data.title: User snippets not working for installed PowerShell extension
data.body:
It appears that PowerShell user snippets aren't working after the user installs the PowerShell extension from the gallery.  I suspect that it has to do with some conflict between the in-box PowerShell support and the installed extension.  When the user clicks "User snippets" in the file menu and gets the language selection popup, PowerShell shows up twice:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79405/11279683/cca617cc-8ea6-11e5-8e22-55be702038ca.png)

I think that since there's a single powershell.json for custom user snippets, it's only being used for the in-box PowerShell support.

Any chance there's a user workaround for this before the issue gets addressed?

data.title: Application freezes after pasting information
data.body:
After install the last update:
Version 0.10.1
Commit df352367df2efcfa9d602d471e4e2f42140a0f05
Shell 0.34.1
Render 45.0.2454.85
Node 4.1.1
With only paste a text in a new file the entire screen freezes, only the menu bar response but don't work.
Operating system windows 8.1.

data.title: Ctrl-Shift-Tab File Switching Querk
data.body: When switching between recent files with the Ctrl-Tab command/menu, if you start going back up the menu with Ctrl-Shift-Tab, the menu closes as soon as Shift is released, even if you're still holding Ctrl. Basically you can't go down the list, go back up, and then go back down again.

data.title: VSCode forgets the file that was open after restarting it when uninstalling an extension.
data.body:
Clicking on the Restart Now button after uninstalling an extension loads an empty VSCode instance with an empty new file and forgets the file that I was working on.

Only happens with files, not if I have a folder open.

I couldn't seem to trace it.

data.title: ES6 imports "go to definition" jumps to import, not original definition

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: When using "go to definition" on a function which has been imported via ES6, vs code jumps to the import statement at the top of the current file. While this might technically be the definition of that variable, it's not particularly useful, as I have to click again to jump to the actual definition, then go back twice to return. The same applies to the hover preview - it shows the import statement, not the function's original definition. ES6 modules in TypeScript suffer from the same problem.

data.title: Support Custom User Agent String in http.proxy
data.body: The http proxy in my work environment only allows certain user-agent string to get through. It would be great if VSCode can support the overriding of user-agent string when pulling extensions from the marketplace.

data.title: [tree] Tree hover has black background in dark theme on Linux
data.body:
Linux, light theme, start debug and hover over any debug tree element. Notice the hover has a black background. I am not styling the tree hover specially so I suspect this is due to the tree styling.
Giving to you since you might know what it is straight away. Feel free to give back to me.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/11277777/34e6e442-8ee8-11e5-8321-abda949a37a2.png)

data.title: Copyright scripts need love :heart:
Shortcut `use regular expression` mode in Find
data.body:
Coming from Sublime Text, trying to use Visual Studio Code.

How can I do the following: Find & select all instances of the `\w*` regular pattern for example..

In Sublime Text (default shortcuts):
1. <kbd>CTRL</kbd>+<kbd>F</kbd>
2. <kbd>ALT</kbd>+<kbd>R</kbd>
3. Enter: `\w*`
4. <kbd>ALT</kbd>+<kbd>ENTER</kbd>

In Visual Studio Code (default shortcuts):
1. <kbd>CTRL</kbd>+<kbd>F</kbd>
2. ????
3. Enter: `\w*`
4. <kbd>CTRL</kbd>+<kbd>SHIFT</kbd>+<kbd>L</kbd>
5. <kbd>ESC</kbd>

data.title: Quick open filters inconsistently between editor history and file search
data.body:
It seems the quick open panel doesn't detect lots of files, see screenshot below:

![vscode1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/199648/11276100/ea59afba-8ee0-11e5-82f1-dd1eb9b9135b.png)

However, if a file has been recently opened, it will appear:

![vscode2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/199648/11276113/f5ccb0f4-8ee0-11e5-898f-9ef6cfffdf09.png)

As I see it, in my example, both files should always appear in quick open panel when typing "bar".

When working on a big project with lots of files this really becomes a problem.

Note: typing "*bar" is a workaround but only for this particular case.

data.title: [javascript] TextMate themes don't seem to apply to all keywords
data.body:
Since last update the default VS Code dark theme has changed (I like the old one because I just don't want bright red colors on the dark background). So I tried (first time I have to admit) create (or modify) a theme via http://tmtheme-editor.herokuapp.com/

Resulting theme is a modification of Visual Studio Dark (uploaded as .txt since .tmTheme is not allowed)
[Visual Studio Dark Modified.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/39136/Visual.Studio.Dark.Modified.txt)

tmtheme-editor online interprets theme as follows:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8778539/11275555/74bee006-8ede-11e5-956a-831aac59ef4e.png)

VS Code however does not interpret theme identically:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8778539/11275539/65af5708-8ede-11e5-941a-b7a2c89f4ae3.png)

Please note that this is my first contact with this stuff - I'm not sure if this is an issue related to VS Code of tmtheme-editor

data.title: How to debug Meteor app?
[debug] Debug console should allow newlines in output

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When I send OutputEvents which contain newlines back from my debug adapter it looks like this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79405/11275026/89b4c03c-8e90-11e5-81d0-ee5f568b5658.png)

Notice the \r\n and the ... at the end of the line.  Would be great if multi-line output would be rendered as expected without the need for sending individual OutputEvents for each line.  Maybe there's some way to do this already that I haven't seen?
